{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3379223,"name":"Matthew","username":"mattathan","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mattathan/{size}/244581_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-03T00:49:42.121Z","cooked":"

Hello!

We’re in search of a new vision processor. We have used a BeeLink in the past, but it broke on us for no reason. Please leave recommendations if you have them!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2024-05-03T00:49:42.121Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":162,"reads":878,"readers_count":877,"score":985.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":465193,"topic_slug":"mini-pc","display_username":"Matthew","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66483,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/mini-pc/465193/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3379238,"name":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","username":"Billfred","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billfred/{size}/225278_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-03T01:15:05.124Z","cooked":"

Orange Pi 5 seems to be the reigning sauce among teams rolling their own solution. I know 4451 was doing multiple cameras off one and running great with it this year.

Can second the Orange Pi recommendation, but if you’re sure you’d like a mini PC I can recommend the Minisforum UM790. You might struggle to power it consistently, though.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2024-05-03T01:37:19.687Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":816,"readers_count":815,"score":188.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":465193,"topic_slug":"mini-pc","display_username":"Max Niederman","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://store.minisforum.com/products/minisforum-um790-pro","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Minisforum UM790 Pro 7940HS Mini PC","clicks":48}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50139,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/mini-pc/465193/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3379277,"name":"Joaquin Del Pego ","username":"jdelpego","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jdelpego/{size}/225535_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-03T02:26:44.107Z","cooked":"

Beelink has been great to us, but I would recommend going with an Orange Pi 5/5+ for a few reasons:

  • Can support multiple cameras for April Tags
  • Relatively cheaper
  • Only Coprocessor supported by Photonvision’s Object Detection Pipeline (Super cool possibilities - see here)

Overall Beelink is still great, but if you are looking to get something else I would get an Orange Pi. We have switched to them recently and it’s been great

thanks! we’re not quite sure why our beelink freaked out. it was only working about 75% of the time out of the box. our electrical lead took it apart and couldn’t really find an issue, so we trashed it. if you have any insights as to what might’ve been the issue based on your experience with them, we’d really appreciate any kind of advice for the future.

if not, you’ve already been extremely helpful! thank you again for your response!

Lead"},"post_url":"/t/mini-pc/465193/7","custom_user_title":"5104 BreakerBots | Software and Additive Mfg. Lead","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3379649,"name":"Woolly","username":"Woolly","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/woolly/{size}/6075_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-03T19:47:21.172Z","cooked":"

Good power delivery for mini pcs is really important. We used This DROKing adjustable regulator set to 19V (website is down right now) and also had to put this 1.25F capacitor bank across the input power leads with a diode on the positive lead before that to keep the capacitors from back-powering the robot.

The orangepi sidesteps this issue but we were trying to cram as much vision performance on the robot as we could get. I don’t know if it was worth the hastle but we’re able to run 4 cameras at 800x600 at ~40FPS on a minisforum um773 lite.

OMG we also use a minusForum!
A mentor made power regulator for us. It’s a custom PCB to 19v

The minipc ran 6 cam set to 20 fps (forgot resolution lol)

We sadly broke most the USB ports, therefore had to dongle all cameras through a usb-c port

I’ll point out that support for the OrangePi 5 is a bit lacking. (For one, you install with the distros on their site and suddenly you’re linked to a repository at huawei… ) The Raspberry Pi 5 isn’t quite as powerful, but the software and support is much stronger.

","post_number":15,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2024-05-04T10:46:45.014Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":13,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":300,"readers_count":299,"score":70.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":465193,"topic_slug":"mini-pc","display_username":"Rocky","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":55750,"username":"mkauffman","name":"Marcus Kauffman","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/9d8465/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":58611,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/mini-pc/465193/15","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3379891,"name":"viggy96","username":"viggy96","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/viggy96/{size}/252784_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-04T11:16:54.310Z","cooked":"

You can use ROCm just fine on an AMD powered mini PC.

We’re running PyTorch models on our MinisForum UM690S with no issues using the integrated graphics on the AMD APU. Could probably run multiple ML pipelines with no issues.

We use the same voltage regulator as @Woolly, but are looking into the MitoCANdria from Grapple Robotics as a possible better solution in the future.

ROCm is the AMD equivalent of CUDA.

Don’t need to have a dedicated GPU. You can use an AMD APU and get great machine learning performance. Our MinisForum UM690S has a Ryzen 6900HX, with an integrated Radeon 680M.

","post_number":17,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2024-05-04T11:23:48.370Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":13,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":288,"readers_count":287,"score":67.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":465193,"topic_slug":"mini-pc","display_username":"viggy96","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":55750,"username":"mkauffman","name":"Marcus Kauffman","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/9d8465/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24613,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"418 Mentor | Tries to be smart"},"post_url":"/t/mini-pc/465193/17","custom_user_title":"418 Mentor | Tries to be smart","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3380253,"name":"Geoffrey","username":"Geoffrey8814","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/geoffrey8814/{size}/262430_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-05T12:11:31.596Z","cooked":"

In our 2024 season, we used Jetson Nano 4gb. We were able to run two cameras with 1280*960 with 25fps on the CPU. We also tried using the Orange Pi 5B, which was able to run apriltag detection up to 100fps for one camera, but we couldn’t get the NPU working. We are currently testing the Jetson Orin Nano 8GB as it’s easier to work with CUDA. We plan to run four cameras on this device.

mkauffman:

Also I really want to see a team run a RTX 3070 on a robot. Probably not going to happen…

How about a 1050Ti?

Vision Processing FPS Programming
Two things mainly. I didn’t want to bother with doing CUDA acceleration for our image homography, so I just tossed it on the AMD board. Maybe I should’ve in retrospect, considering we only got about one frame per second, hah (the SIFT algorithm is very slow turns out). Main thing we use it for, however, is our neural network based robot detection. We actually have a GTX 1050 Ti onboard the robot for neural network acceleration connected to the AMD board (no NVIDIA drivers for ARM platforms like…
